detaileddescription.para: Flags for LoadMediaEx() to customize media loading.
Possible states of a MediaStream. Use SetMediaState() to change the MediaStream's state.

Global properties flags for media configuration. Use SetMediaFlag() and GetMediaFlag() to configure.
: Affects MediaStreams loaded after setting.

Supported audio formats for AudioStream output. Configured using SetMediaFlag(MEDIA_AUDIO_FORMAT, AUDIO_FMT_*).
Increasing output format quality may require adjustments to audio buffer capacities via SetMediaFlag.
Status values for MediaStreamReader callback functions. These values indicate the outcome of custom IO operations.

Stores video and/or audio data from a movie file. Usage:
Initialize with LoadMedia() / LoadMediaEx()
Call UpdateMedia() each frame
Access videoTexture and audioStream for playback
Free with UnloadMedia()
Holds MediaStream properties. Use GetMediaProperties() to retrieve details.
Holds the data needed to implement a custom stream reader. Used to define custom read and seek behaviors for media input streams.

Load a MediaStream from a file.
fileName
Path to the movie file
MediaStream on success; empty structure on failure

Load a MediaStream from a file with flags.
fileName
Path to the movie file
flags
Combination of MediaLoadFlag values
MediaStream on success; empty structure on failure

Load a MediaStream from a custom stream with flags.
streamReader
A valid MediaStreamReader with callback functions and context
flags
Combination of MediaLoadFlag values
MediaStream on success; empty structure on failure

Check if a MediaStream is valid (loaded and initialized).
media
MediaStream structure
true if media is valid; false otherwise

Retrieve properties of the loaded media.
media
A valid MediaStream
Filled MediaProperties structure on success; empty structure on failure

Update a MediaStream.
media
Pointer to a valid MediaStream
true on success; false otherwise

Update a MediaStream with a specified deltaTime.
media
Pointer to a valid MediaStream
deltaTime
Time in seconds since the last update
true on success; false otherwise

Get the state of a MediaStream.
media
A valid MediaStream
Current state; MEDIA_STATE_INVALID on failure

Set the state of a MediaStream (play, pause, or stop).
media
A valid MediaStream
newState
Desired state
The new state on success; MEDIA_STATE_INVALID on failure

Get the playback position of a MediaStream in seconds.
media
A valid MediaStream
Playback position in seconds; negative on failure

Set the playback position of a MediaStream.
media
A valid MediaStream
timeSec
Desired position in seconds
true on success; false otherwise

Enable or disable loop playback for a MediaStream.
media
A valid MediaStream
loopPlay
true to enable looping; false to disable
true on success; false otherwise

Set a global configuration property.
flag
One of MediaConfigFlag values
value
New property value
0 on success; -1 on failure

Get a global configuration property.
flag
One of MediaConfigFlag values
Property value; negative on failure

Unload a MediaStream and free its associated memory.
media
Pointer to a valid MediaStream
